intro: Lobelia leichhardii, commonly known as the Sierra lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Lobelia leichhardii plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
